title: Tinopolis Group Taps Three New Creative Directors for Unscripted â€” Global Bulletin
description:
NEW HIRES	

	The Tinopolis Group has tapped Gill Brown, Tammy Hoyle and Yonni Usiskin as creative directors for three of its unscripted labels.

	B
body:
NEW HIRES	

	The Tinopolis Group has tapped Gill Brown, Tammy Hoyle and Yonni Usiskin as creative directors for three of its unscripted labels.

	Brown joins Tinopolis Scotland, Hoyle joins Firecracker and Usiskin joins Mentorn.Tinopolis Unscripted U.K. CEO Hannah Wyatt, who oversees the three labels, unveiled the news on Wednesday.

	Tinopolis Scotland is a key Glasgow-based production hub, Firecracker is focused on factual entertainment and Mentorn produces premium factual, documentary and true crime.â€œTammy, Yonni and Gill each bring their own unique creative lens and together strengthen our existing team and our ability to deliver premium unscripted content while giving each production company a clear, differentiated editorial and commercial identity,â€ said Wyatt.

schema.headline: Tinopolis Group Taps Three New Creative Directors for Unscripted â€” Global Bulletin

title: Ashley Graham on Her New Wine Brand Lucci Lambrusco, Inclusivity in the Fashion Industry and Victoriaâ€™s Secret: â€˜Do They Have All the Sizes That They Should? No. But Theyâ€™re Working Towards Itâ€™
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Supermode
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	SupermodelÂ Ashley GrahamÂ isÂ familiar with theÂ spotlight.Â From the moment she landed her first modeling gig over 25 years ago,Â sheâ€™sÂ been a champion forÂ diverse representation of bodies in the media landscape.Â Now,Â sheâ€™sÂ ready to embark on a new, albeit intertwined, journey: wine.

	Lucci Lambrusco, aÂ dry, sparkling red wine,Â founded by Graham and her business partner, Danny Epstien, officially launched Wednesday morning. â€œIâ€™ve seen a lot of celebrity brands in the alcohol space, but there isnâ€™t anything on the market [where] you can say, â€˜Oh, I know this Lambrusco that I love very well, and just blurt the name out,'â€ Graham says over a Zoom call ahead of the launch. â€œThereâ€™sÂ many different tequilas, white wines, Proseccos. But when it comes to an actual Lambrusco, thereÂ [wasnâ€™t] one.â€


	The other â€œWhy?â€ for starting this new brand? Bubbles. â€œThe bubble alcohol business is aÂ $10 billion business,â€ Graham says. â€œItâ€™sÂ growing rapidly.â€

	Our conversation starts with a history lesson, as she explainsÂ that Lambrusco was popular inÂ the United StatesÂ in the â€™80s, andÂ asÂ palates changedÂ andÂ people stopped drinking it,Â the beverageÂ became harder to find. Now she only sees it at â€œtrendy restaurantsâ€ or â€œrandom little wine shops,â€ rather than grocery and liquor stores. Graham recognizesÂ thatÂ gap in the market as an opportunity to â€œrevive a category thatâ€™s been dead for a very long time.â€Â Â 

	Itâ€™sÂ no secret that the alcoholic beverage sector has grown increasingly saturated with celebrity brands,Â but bringing Lambrusco back from the dead â€“ at least in the United StatesÂ â€“Â is exactly whatÂ GrahamÂ says makesÂ LucciÂ so unique.Â 


	LucciÂ took three years to build, and Graham credits this toÂ meticulous attention to detail. Alongside Epstien,Â sheÂ saysÂ it was important thatÂ this projectÂ didnâ€™tÂ feel like they were â€œthrowing spaghetti on the wall.â€Â She continues, â€œIfÂ Iâ€™mÂ not going to eat it, wear it, ride it, enjoy it, have itÂ beÂ a part of my life and my culture, in my home and everything, thenÂ itâ€™sÂ not going to sell.Â Itâ€™sÂ not going to doÂ anything for me.Â Whatâ€™sÂ it going to do for the people who follow me?â€Â Â 

	The intersection of entrepreneurship and modeling is brought up by Graham before I get a chance to ask. She compares reviving a category to her career; sheâ€™sÂ used to changing peopleâ€™s minds â€” whether it be about body diversity or sparkling red wine.Â 

	On the topic of her career,Â she touches on the current state of theÂ fashionÂ industryÂ and a regression of inclusivity in recent years. â€œThereâ€™s felt like a big shift in the fashion industry for plus-size girls just in the last few years,â€ Graham says. â€œItâ€™s been gutting and hard to swallow because thereâ€™s just not been as much opportunity.â€ She does believe that there has been slow and steady progress for brands like Victoriaâ€™s Secret, though, saying that they have â€œliterallyÂ opened upÂ the doors to more plus sizes.â€ But naturally, â€œthey still have aÂ waysÂ to go.â€

	â€œDo they have all the sizes that theyÂ should toÂ be a true body diversity brand? No, theyÂ donâ€™t,â€ she admits. â€œThatâ€™sÂ not okay, but whatâ€™s okay is thatÂ theyâ€™reÂ working towards it.â€

	As she looks ahead, she teasesÂ thatÂ she will make a few surprise appearancesÂ across film and television this year. In Dec. 2025, Variety reported that she would be a guest star in the upcoming final season of â€œSurvival of the Thickest.â€ Most recently, she executive-produced and starred in â€œSide Hustlers,â€ a reality competition show following several women trying to scale up their side hustles.

	Beyond that, she just wants people to enjoy what sheâ€™s spent three years creating.Â If the brand releases additional products, sheÂ indicatedÂ that consumer feedback would be top of mind; â€œIf we end up doing another SKU, itâ€™ll be one that the people have said that they wanted.â€Â 


	When first tasked with the challenge of bringing Lambrusco back into theÂ American household, Graham askedÂ herself,Â â€œWho better to do it than me?â€Â After tasting it,Â Iâ€™dÂ have toÂ agree.Â 

	LucciÂ retails for $19.99 and isÂ availableÂ online at www.reservebar.com and other major retailers, including Whole Foods, Publix, Harris Teeter, and Total Wine.Â Â

schema.headline: Ashley Graham on Her New Wine Brand Lucci Lambrusco, Inclusivity in the Fashion Industry and Victoriaâ€™s Secret: â€˜Do They Have All the Sizes That They Should? No. But Theyâ€™re Working Towards Itâ€™

title: Milly Alcock, Yvonne Strahovski and Olympian Ian Thorpe to Be Honored at Gâ€™Day USA Arts Gala (EXCLUSIVE)
description: The American Australian Association and Gâ€™Day USAÂ will honor Milly Alcock, Yvonne Strahovski and Olympian Ian Thorpe at this yearâ€™sÂ Gâ€™Day USA Arts G
body:
The American Australian Association and Gâ€™Day USAÂ will honor Milly Alcock, Yvonne Strahovski and Olympian Ian Thorpe at this yearâ€™sÂ Gâ€™Day USA Arts Gala.

	Taking place on Feb. 26 atÂ The Lot at Formosa in Hollywood, the annual black-tie event will be hosted by comedian Monty Franklin.

	Alcock will be presented with theÂ Rising Star Award, honoring her rapidly ascending career and standout performances in film (â€œSuperman,â€ â€œSupergirlâ€)Â and on televisionÂ (â€œHouse of the Dragonâ€).
	

	Strahovski will receive theÂ Excellence in Film and Television AwardÂ in recognition of her work across television and film, highlighted by her Emmy-nominated role inÂ â€œThe Handmaidâ€™s Tale.â€ She first rose to global prominence withÂ â€œChuck,â€ with additional credits includingÂ â€œStateless,â€Â â€œThe Tomorrow Warâ€ andÂ â€œTeacup.â€


	Thorpe will be honored with theÂ Global Impact Award, recognizing his extraordinary athletic legacy and ongoing influence beyond sport, with a special acknowledgment of Australiaâ€™s role as host of theÂ Brisbane 2032 Olympic Games.

	Australian recording artistsÂ Boy Soda,Â Thelma Plum,Â GordiÂ andÂ Vanessa Amorosi are set to perform at the gala.

	The 2026 Gâ€™Day USA Arts Gala will raise funds for the American Australian Association and its Arts Fund, which provides scholarships and professional development opportunities for emerging American and Australian artists.

	The Gala also marks a new era of leadership for the Association under its recently appointed president, The HonÂ Steven MarshallÂ AO,Â former Premier of South Australia.
	

	For more than two decades, the Gâ€™Day USA Arts Gala has celebrated Australian excellence in the United States, honoring leaders in film, television, music, sports and culture while fostering cross-Pacific collaboration.

	Presenting sponsors include FOX, IREN, News Corp, Qantas, Stan,Â Screen Australia and Tourism Australia.

	For more information go to americanaustralian.org.

schema.headline: Milly Alcock, Yvonne Strahovski and Olympian Ian Thorpe to Be Honored at Gâ€™Day USA Arts Gala (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Kenan Thompson and Lamorne Morris to Star in Action Comedy Movie â€˜Unwanted,â€™ Based on the Hit QCode Podcast (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Kenan Thompson and Lamorne Morris are teaming up for a new action comedy, based on the popular QCode podcast â€œUnwanted.â€

	Morris and his longtime c
body:
Kenan Thompson and Lamorne Morris are teaming up for a new action comedy, based on the popular QCode podcast â€œUnwanted.â€

	Morris and his longtime creative partner, Kyle Shevrin, wrote and directed the original series, which topped the fiction podcast charts upon its release in 2021. â€œUnwantedâ€ centers on two degenerates who attempt to claim a $1 million reward by capturing an escaped convicted murderer. But, as the logline explains, that plan quickly unravels as they find themselves dangerously unprepared for the chaos that follows. 
	

	Production on the movie, directed by Richie Keen (â€œGhosts,â€ â€œItâ€™s Always Sunny in Philadelphia,â€ â€œFist Fightâ€), is slated to begin this summer. Morris and Shevrin wrote the screenplay and will produce the project via their 11 Below banner alongside Thompson and John Ryan Jr.â€™s Artists For Artists (AFA) company.


	Carter Swan, Billy Magnussen (who co-starred in the podcast opposite Morris), and QCodeâ€™s Rob Herting, Ben Curtis and Nick Shanks are also on board to produce. Jonathan Davino serves as executive producer.

	Morris announced the developing project during an episode of his and Shevrinâ€™s podcast â€œThe Lamorning After,â€ where Thompson appeared as a guest. The full episode can be seen below. 



	Morris, an Emmy winner for FXâ€™s â€œFargo,â€ will next be seen starring opposite Nicolas Cage in Prime Videoâ€™s live-action â€œSpider-Noirâ€ series and is currently in production on â€œJumanji 4.â€ In addition to â€œThe Lamorning After,â€ Morris also hosts the â€œNew Girlâ€ rewatch podcast â€œThe Mess Aroundâ€ with former castmate Hannah Simone.
	

	Thompson continues his tenure as the longest-running cast member of â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ which is currently airing Season 51. The Emmy winner also co-hosts and produces Prime Videoâ€™s weekly sports series â€œGood Sportsâ€ with Kevin Hart. In film, Thompson most recently reteamed with Kel Mitchell for the long-awaited â€œGood Burger 2â€ for Paramount+, and the longtime duo will next star in the horror comedy â€œKenan & Kel Meet Frankenstein.â€

	Morris is represented by Entertainment 360, CAA, The Lede Company and Myman Greenspan; Thompson is represented by Range Media Partners; and Keen is represented by CAA and Artists First.

schema.headline: Kenan Thompson and Lamorne Morris to Star in Action Comedy Movie â€˜Unwanted,â€™ Based on the Hit QCode Podcast (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Sean Pennâ€™s â€˜Animals in Warâ€™ Finds North American Distribution With Omnibus Entertainment (EXCLUSIVE)
description: â€œAnimals in War,â€ a Sean-Penn starring anthology telling the true stories of animals impacted by the war in Ukraine, has been picked up by Omnibus E
body:
â€œAnimals in War,â€ a Sean-Penn starring anthology telling the true stories of animals impacted by the war in Ukraine, has been picked up by Omnibus Entertainment for North American distribution. 

	The anthology was made by Ukrainian filmmakers in response to Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine. Showcasing seven standalone stories, the film explores the humanitarian and ecological consequences of war through the eyes of animals and people. It had its world premiere at Tribeca and received three Ukrainian Film Critics Awards nominations. 
	

	A label of NY-based distributor Film Movement, Omnibus Entertainment will release the film on VOD, on digital outlets and home entertainment. 


	Penn said: â€œThe film makes an important statement about how Ukrainians hold onto their humanity, despite all the injustice, violence, and destruction of this horrific Russian invasion.â€

	â€œThese stories inspire all of us,â€ Penn added, â€œand show how people in the midst of tragedy and terror can bravely persevere while holding onto their compassion.â€

	Each chapter centers on an animal, from a white rabbit and a wolf to a cow, blending stark realism with poetic imagery.

	Creator and producer Oleg Kokhan said, â€œAnimals have no politics and yet are the target, along with their civilian caretakers, of unrelenting waves of terror.â€ Kokhan pointed out the film â€œshows that even when facing real evil, humanity can be preserved.â€

	â€œâ€˜Animals inÂ Warâ€™ offers a strikingly original perspective on the human and environmental cost of this invasion, and weâ€™re honored to bring it to North American audiences,â€ said Film Movementâ€™s president MichaelÂ Rosenberg, who unveiled the deal with producerÂ Oleksiy Makukhin and executive producerÂ Adam Sigel at Berlinâ€™s European Film Market. 
	

	The companyâ€™s recent acquisitions also include â€œBarrio Tristeâ€ from Harmony Korineâ€™s production company Edglrd; and Dominik Mollâ€™s Cannes competition movie â€œCase 137â€ which is nominated for multiple Cesar Awards.

schema.headline: Sean Pennâ€™s â€˜Animals in Warâ€™ Finds North American Distribution With Omnibus Entertainment (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Scripps Layoffs Loom as Company Sets Major Cost-Cutting and Revenue Growth Plan That Will Include Use of AI and Automation
description: E.W. Scripps Co. is expecting to make layoffs in the near future as the company, which operates more than 60 local TV stations in the U.S., has emba
body:
E.W. Scripps Co. is expecting to make layoffs in the near future as the company, which operates more than 60 local TV stations in the U.S., has embarked on a plan aimed at boosting adjusted earnings by up to $150 million over the next three years.

	This week at its headquarters in Cincinnati, Scripps said, it gathered a team of 200 managers â€œcharged with carrying out the transformation.â€ The company said will share more details of its transformation plan on its Feb. 26 earnings call after reporting fourth-quarter 2025 financial results, including the â€œtiming cadence of savings being realized and the costs to achieve the savings.â€
	

	The scope of the layoffs at Scripps has yet to be determined. As of Dec. 31, 2024, Scripps reported having about 5,000 employees, including full-time and part-time employees. Of those, various labor unions represented approximately 360, all of which are in its local media group.


	Scripps announced its â€œenterprise-wide transformation planâ€ on Wednesday. Thatâ€™s designed to â€œimprove operating performance and unlock new value,â€ targeting annualized earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) growth of $125 million-$150 million by 2028. The company will deliver the improved EBITDA run-rate through cost savings and revenue growth initiatives that will â€œleverage technology including AI and automationâ€ and increase revenue yield for its existing businesses.

	In announcing the plan, Scripps CEO Adam Symson â€œreaffirmed Scrippsâ€™ commitment to its local and national news, sports and entertainment programming, which Americans depend on to connect them to their communities, to their favorite teams, to their passions and to each other.â€ 
	

	â€œScripps is nearly 150 years old, and we have thrived for so long because doing well by doing good is in our DNA,â€ said Symson. â€œWe are taking E.W. Scrippsâ€™ founding mission and values for the enterprise, overlaying todayâ€™s company vision to create connection, and doing so with operating principles and a cost structure we would have if we were to be founded today.â€

	Last fall Sinclair, the U.S.â€™s biggest local TV station group operator, made an unsolicited takeover offer for Scripps. The board of Scripps in December rejected the proposal. The hostile bid came as Nexstar Media Group agreed to acquire Tegna, in a $6 billion transaction that would run afoul of the FCCâ€™s 39% ownership cap; Nexstar has filed for a waiver to the ownership cap.

	Scripps is scheduled to release Q4 2025 earnings after market close on Feb. 25. The company reaffirmed the guidance it issued with its earnings results on Nov. 6.

	For the third quarter of 2025, ScrippsÂ revenue fell 19% to $526 million, as revenue in its local TV group dropped 27% to $325 million. Net loss attributable to shareholders of $49 million (or 55 cents per share). That included a $7.6 million loss on extinguishment of debt, $6.5 million of financing transaction costs, a $1.4 million write-off of deferred financing costs and $2.7 million in restructuring costs.

	In reporting Q3 results, Scripps said employee costs came down in both its Local Media and Scripps Networks divisions, and Symson said that â€œweâ€™re seeing the ongoing effect of reductions in our Scripps News operations last fall.â€ For Q4, the company expects Local Media revenue to decline about 30% and Scripps Networks sales to be down in the â€œlow double-digit percent range.â€

	Looking ahead, Scripps expects 2026 financial performance to be bolstered by a â€œrobust midterm election spending year,â€ as well as the Winter Olympics on its 11 NBC stations and the World Cup competitions in North America as well as its Scripps Sports partnerships, its networks distribution on connected TV and the results of accretive divestiture and acquisition activity.

	Earlier this week, Scripps announced a deal to sell Court TV to Law&Crime, the true-crime and legal content network led by Dan Abrams that is now owned by Jellysmack. Financial terms werenâ€™t disclosed; the deal reportedly values Court TV at less than $125 million.
	

	In addition to its local TV stations, Scripps also operates national news outlet Scripps News and entertainment brands ION, ION Plus, ION Mystery, Bounce, Grit and Laff. Itâ€™s also known for being the longtime steward of the Scripps National Spelling Bee.

schema.headline: Scripps Layoffs Loom as Company Sets Major Cost-Cutting and Revenue Growth Plan That Will Include Use of AI and Automation

title: â€˜XO, Kittyâ€™ Sets Season 3 Release Date, Drops First-Look Images
description: Season 3 of â€œXO, Kitty,â€ Netflixâ€™s hit rom-com following teen matchmaker Kitty Song Covey (Anna Cathcart), will premiere on the platform on April 2.
body:
Season 3 of â€œXO, Kitty,â€ Netflixâ€™s hit rom-com following teen matchmaker Kitty Song Covey (Anna Cathcart), will premiere on the platform on April 2. The forthcoming season will follow the series standard format of eight 30-minute episodes.Â 

	Created by Jenny Han and showrun and written by Valentina Garza, Season 3 will follow the youngest Covey as she returns for her senior year at KISS. â€œSheâ€™s going to make meaningful memories with her friends, grow closer to her relatives in Korea and make big decisions about her future,â€ reads the official logline. â€œAnd sheâ€™s going to define her relationship with Min Ho. For real this time. But when surprise revelations throw her plans, and relationships, of course, Kitty will have to learn to embrace the unexpected.â€Â 
	

	In addition to Cathcart, returning cast members include Minyeong Choi (Dae), Gia Kim (Yuri), Sang Heon Lee (Min Ho), Anthony Keyvan (Q), Regan Aliyah (Juliana) and Hojo Shin (Jiwon). Peter Thurnwald (Alex), Joshua Lee (Jin), Sasha Bhasin (Praveena), Michael K. Lee (Professor Lee), Philippe Lee (Mr. Moon), Jocelyn Shelfo (Madison), Han Bi Ryu (Eunice) and Sunny Oh (Mihee) also return as regulars.Â 


	Previously, Variety reported that the series had added three new cast members: Sule Thelwell (Marius), Soy Kim (Yisoo) and Christine Hwang (Gigi).Â Â 

	â€œXO, Kittyâ€ first began as a spinoff series of the â€œTo All the Boysâ€ film franchise, based off Hanâ€™s book series, which includes â€œTo All the Boys Iâ€™ve Loved Before,â€ â€œTo All the Boys: P.S. I Still Love Youâ€ and â€œTo All the Boys: Always and Forever.â€Â 
	

	Back in 2018, Netflix told Variety that â€œTo All the Boys Iâ€™ve Loved Beforeâ€ was one of its â€œmost viewed original films ever.â€ â€œXO, Kittyâ€ has also been successful for the streamer; according to Netflix, Season 2 of the show debuted at No. 2 on the English TV List with 14.2 million views.Â 

	The Paramount Television Studios series is executive produced by Garza, Han, Bradley Gardner and Matt Kaplan of ACE Entertainment.Â 

	See first-look images here.

title: Piers Morgan Rejects Megyn Kellyâ€™s Meltdown Over Bad Bunny, Then Asks: Is MAGA Going â€˜Wokeâ€™ and â€˜Thin-Skinnedâ€™ Amid Super Bowl Outrage?
description: Is MAGA going woke? Itâ€™s a question Piers Morgan is currently floating as Trumpâ€™s fanbase continues to be outraged over Bad Bunnyâ€˜s Super Bowl Halft
body:
Is MAGA going woke? Itâ€™s a question Piers Morgan is currently floating as Trumpâ€™s fanbase continues to be outraged over Bad Bunnyâ€˜s Super Bowl Halftime Show. While the left is often accused of being political snowflakes, Morgan sees MAGAâ€™s complete meltdown over Bad Bunny to be more or less that.

	â€œPresident Trump and MAGA skillfully rode the post-woke wave as that whole joyless mindset came crashing down. The left had become the sneering, censorious ogres demanding puritanical fealty,â€ Morgan said on the Feb. 10 episode of â€œPiers Morgan Uncensored.â€ 
	

	â€œConservatives were the ones having a laugh, to quote JD Vance, as star athletes honored the Trump YMCA dance and a nation bathed in woke tears,â€ he continued. â€œWell, last yearâ€™s Super Bowl really proved the point. The ads were full of bros, burgers and bikinis. The new president got a standing ovation. But how quickly things can change. Of course, itâ€™s difficult to maintain that renegade spirit when youâ€™re actually in power. You have to make unpopular decisions. People realize that you canâ€™t, in fact, please everybody all the time. And with a lot of the furious reaction to Bad Bunnyâ€™s spectacular and largely non-political halftime show at this yearâ€™s Super Bowl, itâ€™s worth asking whether the culture is now shifting. Is MAGA becoming a bit thin-skinned, a bit sneering, a bit censorious, a bitâ€”dare I suggest itâ€”woke?â€


	Morgan even challenged one of MAGAâ€™s most outspoken voices, Megyn Kelly. He invited the former Fox News host onto his show the day after the Super Bowl, and she proceeded to go on a tirade against Bad Bunny.
	

	â€œIâ€™m sorry, Piers, but to get up there and perform the whole show in Spanish is a middle finger to the rest of America,â€ Kelly said in hysterics. â€œWho gives a damn that we have 40 million Spanish speakers in the United States? We have 310 million who donâ€™t speak a lick of Spanishâ€¦ This is supposed to be a unifying event for the country, not for the Latinos, not for one small group, but for the country. We donâ€™t need a Black national anthem. We donâ€™t need a Spanish-speaking non-English performer. And we donâ€™t need an ICE or America hater featured as our prime time entertainment.â€

	Morgan fired back at Kelly that the USA actually does not have an official language, proving her point mute. This prompted Kelly to dramatically lambast Morganâ€™s home of Great Britain.

	â€œYou ceded your culture to a bunch of radical Muslims who came in and took over and now itâ€™s gone. Weâ€™re not allowing that here,â€ Kelly told Morgan. â€œWhether itâ€™s Hispanic, whether itâ€™s Muslim, itâ€™s not happening in the United States of America. Thatâ€™s why President Trump was elected. And whether itâ€™s Bad Bunny, who is American but refuses to speak English in his performances, or anybody else, we have to keep the Super Bowl, which is a quintessential American event.â€

	MAGAâ€™s hatred of Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl Halftime was fueled by Trump himself, who originally said it was â€œridiculousâ€ for the NFL to choose the artist as its big game performer. This resulted in Turning Point USA creating an alternative halftime show headlined by Kid Rock, viewership of which (6 million real time viewers on YouTube) paled in comparison to the 128.2 million viewers who watched Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl show. Trump took to social media during the big gameâ€™s second half to slam Bad Bunny.

	â€œThe Super Bowl Halftime ShowÂ is absolutely terrible, one of the worst, EVER!â€ Trump posted on Truth Social. â€œIt makes no sense, is an affront to the Greatness of America, and doesnâ€™t represent our standards of Success, Creativity, or Excellence. Nobody understands a word this guy is saying, and the dancing is disgusting, especially for young children that are watching from throughout the U.S.A., and all over the World. This â€˜Showâ€™ is just a â€˜slap in the faceâ€™ to our Country.â€

schema.headline: Piers Morgan Rejects Megyn Kellyâ€™s Meltdown Over Bad Bunny, Then Asks: Is MAGA Going â€˜Wokeâ€™ and â€˜Thin-Skinnedâ€™ Amid Super Bowl Outrage?

title: â€˜Crime 101â€™ Review: Chris Hemsworth and Mark Ruffalo Lead a Tip-Top Cast in a Jewel-Heist Thriller More About Character Than Crime
description: â€œCrime 101â€ is an underworld drama thatâ€™s clever and compelling in unusual ways. Itâ€™s got a couple of car chases through Los Angeles that feel gripp
body:
â€œCrime 101â€ is an underworld drama thatâ€™s clever and compelling in unusual ways. Itâ€™s got a couple of car chases through Los Angeles that feel grippingly unchoreographed, as if the drivers really were figuring out at the last moment where to turn next, yet itâ€™s not an action movie. The central character, Davis (Chris Hemsworth), is a jewel thief who specializes in meticulously targeted robberies that you could definitely call heists, though the film doesnâ€™t have the trap-door blitheness of a â€œheist thriller.â€ â€œCrime 101â€ includes crime aplenty, but at heart itâ€™s a character study â€” or, rather, four character studies wound into one. Based on a novella by Don Winslow (â€œSavagesâ€), the film is just moody and intricate enough to feel the-Michael-Mann-of-â€œThiefâ€-adjacent, but itâ€™s really a portrait of lost souls working to keep their heads in a corrupt world. Maybe thatâ€™s why â€œCrime 101â€ plays like a bit of a head game, in a way that may not do it any favors at the box office.
	

	Yet I was held by how the film lets its actors make their mark. In the elaborate opening sequence, Davis steals some hot diamonds from a local jeweler and his assistants, which involves stopping them in cars and getting lucky enough to just be missed by a bullet fired from an ancient faulty pistol. Hemsworth plays this for maximum cool, and heâ€™s good enough at it that for 10 minutes or so weâ€™re wondering if he should be the next James Bond.


	But then Davis meets up with his boss, Money, played by Nick Nolte with an old manâ€™s jagged rasp as dramatic as his wry middle-aged intensity used to be. And we notice a fascinating quality just beneath Hemsworthâ€™s stoicism. His Davis, with short dark hair and a beard and a glint of dread in his eye, is edgy and preoccupied, maybe even a bit nervous. About what? Heâ€™s a ruthless operator, but he isnâ€™t fully at home in the world, or in his own skin. And itâ€™s that quality of barely submerged anxiety that makes this one of Hemsworthâ€™s best performances, and keeps the film arrestingly off balance.
	

	Davis commits his robberies along the 101 freeway, and never harms anyone. Thatâ€™s his pattern, and itâ€™s one that Lou Lubesnick (Mark Ruffalo), a smart LAPD detective, has picked up on. But how to catch him? Ruffalo, doughy and unshaven, with an unfashionable mound of gray-black curls, plays Lou as the Last Honest Cop in L.A., and whatâ€™s notable is the form the corruption around him takes. The LAPD, as the movie portrays it, has become a corporation, and the pressure to close cases is like the pressure to close deals; it leads to solving crimes at any cost. Lou, the old-school knight, with his grizzled â€œirrelevantâ€ integrity, is viewed by his colleagues as a loser, a perception weâ€™re invited to share when his long-time girlfriend (Jennifer Jason Leigh) dumps him.

	Halle Berry, meanwhile, plays a winner trapped in the wrong industry. Her Sharon Coombs is a high-end insurance broker who hawks pricey policies to wealthy clients, sugaring her pitch with a hint of seduction. Sheâ€™s been with her firm 11 years, but the old boysâ€™ network keeps hedging on making her a partner. She has hit the glass ceiling with nowhere to turn, and Berry laces her vibrance with an undertow of anger that ripples into despair. That makes her a ripe partner for Davis, who needs a new source of potential marks, and also Lou, who she gets to know in yoga class. That Sharon is linked to both criminal and cop is one of those only-in-the-movies contrivances you just have to roll with. Itâ€™s a wobbly link, but Berry makes it emotionally credible.

	The last major character is Ormon (Barry Keoghan), the thug hired by Nolteâ€™s Money to terrorize his former protÃ©gÃ©, and to make sure that any robbery ends with the money in the correct pocket (his). Keoghan plays most of his scenes hidden under a motorcycle helmet and bikerâ€™s jacket (much of the time, you can only see his eyes), and itâ€™s a credit to the actor that his personality busts through anyway; itâ€™s there in the brutish impatience of his movements.

	The writer-director, Bart Layton, shoots L.A. with an expansive feel for its anonymous concrete nooks and crannies, and he takes his time (the movie runs two hours and 19 minutes), lingering on scenes like Davisâ€™s first date with Maya (a charismatically sunny Monica Barbaro), who he meets when she backends his car, or Sharonâ€™s encounters at the insurance office, a vipersâ€™ nest where sheâ€™s starting to be overshadowed by a younger rival. What makes all of this work is that itâ€™s the filmâ€™s way of coloring in the motivation for crime. Davis, raised as a foster child, is trying to construct an ordered world for himself. Thatâ€™s why heâ€™s such a cautious thief, controlled to a fault. He breaks with Money over the prospect of a Santa Barbara jewelry-store robbery he considers too risky â€” which doesnâ€™t stop the loose-cannon Ormon from taking on the assignment and making a violent mess of it.
	

	If the criminals in â€œCrime 101â€ are mostly more interesting than their crimes, the climactic robbery that unfolds in a suite of the Beverly Wilshire Hotel delivers the jolt of crazy danger weâ€™ve been wanting. The scene is a layer cake of deception, with Davis impersonating the driver who has picked up the diamond carrier, and Lou impersonating the carrier (they have a great exchange about Steve McQueen), all building to a shootout designed to reveal the hidden core of every individual in the room. Taken as a thriller, â€œCrime 101â€ has its indulgences, but by the end it can stand as an advanced course in what underworld dreams are made of.

schema.headline: â€˜Crime 101â€™ Review: Chris Hemsworth and Mark Ruffalo Lead a Tip-Top Cast in a Jewel-Heist Thriller More About Character Than Crime

title: Guy Pearce, Jared Harris, Merab Ninidze to Star in Anthony McCartenâ€™s â€˜The Price of Peaceâ€™
description: Four-time Oscar-nominated filmmaker Anthony McCarten will direct a political thriller set during the pivotal 1945 Potsdam Conference, with Guy Pearc
body:
Four-time Oscar-nominated filmmaker Anthony McCarten will direct a political thriller set during the pivotal 1945 Potsdam Conference, with Guy Pearce, Jared Harris and Merab Ninidze leading the cast.

	â€œThe Price of Peaceâ€ chronicles the historic meeting between President Harry S. Truman, Prime Minister Winston Churchill and Soviet leader Joseph Stalin as they negotiated the future of post-war Europe. SND is introducing the project to international buyers at the European Film Market.
	

	Principal photography is scheduled to commence in London and Potsdam during summer 2026, with delivery anticipated in 2027. The production reunites McCarten with historical subject matter following his work on â€œDarkest Hour,â€ â€œBohemian Rhapsody,â€ â€œThe Theory of Everythingâ€ and â€œThe Two Popes.â€


	Pearce will portray Truman, Harris takes on Churchill, and Ninidze plays Stalin. The narrative centers on July 1945, as the three leaders converge with competing agendas: Truman seeking to end the Pacific War, Churchill facing domestic elections, and Stalin pursuing territorial expansion. Their negotiations would establish the foundation for decades of Cold War politics.

	â€œThe Potsdam Conference represented a crucial turning point in world history â€“ the moment when World War II transformed into the Cold War,â€ McCarten said. â€œThis is not a biopic, but rather a political thriller where the stakes are frankly enormous.â€

	Raccoon Features, Muse of Fire Productions, Salloway Studios and Spark Productions are producing in association with Ingara. SND serves as co-producer while handling international sales and French distribution. CAA Media Finance is co-repping U.S. rights alongside SND.
	

	Jonathan Saubach and Philipp Klausing produce for Raccoon Features, Matthew Salloway for Salloway Studios, McCarten for Muse of Fire Productions and Eric Falkenstein for Spark Productions.

	â€œWorking on â€˜The Price of Peaceâ€™ with filmmaker Anthony McCarten is exactly where we want to be with Raccoon,â€ said Klausing. â€œTelling captivating stories with relevance and urgency to an audience around the world is why we do it in the first place.â€

	Ramy Nahas, director of international sales and distribution at SND, compared the project to â€œDarkest Hourâ€ and â€œThe Kingâ€™s Speech,â€ noting McCartenâ€™s â€œremarkable talent for injecting genuine suspense and emotional depth into well-known historical events.â€

	Raccoon Features, based in Berlin and London, is currently in production on Peter Morganâ€™s â€œThe Boys from Brazilâ€ for Netflix, starring Jeremy Strong, Gillian Anderson and August Diehl.

schema.headline: Guy Pearce, Jared Harris, Merab Ninidze to Star in Anthony McCartenâ€™s â€˜The Price of Peaceâ€™

title: New Nancy Guthrie Note, Sender Demands 1 Bitcoin for Info On Kidnapping Suspect
description:
Nancy Guthrie Case
                          New Note Demands 1 Bitcoin to Rat Out Suspect
body:
Nancy Guthrie Case
                          New Note Demands 1 Bitcoin to Rat Out Suspect
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 11, 2026
                            7:24 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 11, 2026
                                8:35 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          There's a new note in the Nancy Guthrie case, but this one doesn't seem to be from the kidnapper ... instead, it's from someone offering to give up information on the kidnapper.
      
    
          TMZ received the note just before 5 AM PT, and the sender claims they've tried unsuccessfully to reach Savannah Guthrie's brother, Camron, and her sister, Annie, by email and text. The note goes on, "If they want the name of the individual involved then I want 1 Bitcoin to the following wallet. Time is more than relevant."
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          There is a legitimate bitcoin address in the note ... and it is a different address from the one in the original ransom note, received by TMZ and 2 Tucson TV news stations.
      
    
          We have forwarded this note to the FBI.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          It's unclear if the sender of this note is legit, but interestingly, 1 bitcoin is worth about $66,000 right now. You'll recall law enforcement is currently offering a $50,000 reward for information leading to Nancy's kidnappers.
      
    
          This comes less than 24 hours after a flurry of activity in the case -- on Tuesday, the FBI released the first images of the armed individual who showed up on Nancy's doorstep early in the morning of Feb. 1, the day she was taken.
      
    
          Then, in the evening, cops detained a person of interest ... a deliveryman who was pulled over in a Tucson suburb. After questioning him, though, law enforcement released the man, who told reporters he didn't even know who Nancy was.

title: Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni Arrive at Court for Settlement Conference
description:
Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni
                          Show Up at Court for Showdown
body:
Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni
                          Show Up at Court for Showdown
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 11, 2026
                            6:23 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 11, 2026
                                7:54 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni just walked into a New York City court house -- separately -- to face off in their ongoing legal battle.
      
    
          Today's settlement conference was court-ordered in an effort to get the actors to hash out their differences. It's essentially a Hail Mary attempt to find a resolution before their May 18 trial date.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    BACKGRID
          
    
          As you know ... Blake filed a complaint against her "It Ends With Us" costar in December 2024, alleging he sexually harassed her while working on the film.
      
    
          Since then, the clash has snowballed into one of the messiest Hollywood legal battles in recent memory, with discovery from the case pulling big-name stars like Taylor Swift and powerhouse production companies like Sony Pictures into the fray.
      

          Taylor will be called as a witness by Baldoni if the case goes to trial. We're told Taylor would be called as a hostile witness, meaning that because she clearly had a bias against Baldoni, his lawyer, Bryan Freedman, can really put her on the hot seat by asking leading questions.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The Grammy winner is friends with Blake, and the two texted at length about Baldoni.
      
    
          As we reported ... Baldoni countersued Lively, claiming he suffered $400 million in damages because she defamed him with her bogus allegations. But the lawsuit was dismissed when a judge ruled Baldoni didn't have the right to sue for defamation over accusations written in a legal filing.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Blake Lively

schema.headline: Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni Arrive at Court for Settlement Conference

title: Massive Police Presence At Arizona Home in Connection to Nancy Guthrie Abduction
description:
Nancy Guthrie Abduction
                          Cops Swarm Home Connected to Person Detained
body:
Nancy Guthrie Abduction
                          Cops Swarm Home Connected to Person Detained
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 10, 2026
                            9:31 PM PST
                                                                            
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          A massive police presence lit up the quiet town of Rio Rico, Arizona late Tuesday night and it's all tied to the disappearance of Savannah Guthrie's mom, Nancy.
      
    
          Videos online show a swarm of law enforcement vehicles descending on a neighborhood less than 15 miles from the Port of Nogales, a major U.S.-Mexico border crossing.
      
    
      
      VIDEO OF DETAINMENT SCENE: Viewer submitted video of the traffic stop made in Rio Rico that led to the detainment of a person connected to the Nancy Guthrie case. (VIDEO: Krystal Bacica) pic.twitter.com/9Mf01lwNu0â€” KGUN 9 (@kgun9) February 11, 2026
              @kgun9
          
  
    
          The person detained for questioning's mother-in-law told reporters outside the house her son-in-law was the person detained, but insisted he has nothing to do with Nancy's disappearance.
      
    
          The Pima County Sheriff's Department confirmed they're conducting a court authorized search at the location as part of the ongoing investigation into Nancy's disappearance.
      
    
          We broke the story ... law enforcement sources told us the person of interest that was detained by sheriff's deputies for questioning earlier on Tuesday is NOT a member of the Guthrie family.
      

          According to the Pima County Sheriff's Office, the person was stopped during a traffic stop south of Tucson.
      
    
          As we first reported, Guthrieâ€™s disappearance has sparked growing concern and a multi-agency effort to track down answers. Now, with federal agents on the ground and a search underway near the border, the case appears to be intensifying.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          As we told you, the abductor was promising to return Nancy to Tucson within 12 hours of receiving the $6 million ransom ... which means they're currently somewhere within a roughly 700-mile radius of Tucson.
      
    
          There were 2 ransom deadlines, both of which have passed ... even though Savannah tried reaching out to the kidnapper and even offered to pay up.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Tuesday afternoon we noticed activity for the first time in the Bitcoin account listed in the first ransom note that was sent.
      
    
          This morning, the FBI released the first images of Nancy's apparent kidnapper ... and the feds blasted the footage out to the public on the same day they received the info.
      
    
          Nancy has a pacemaker and needs daily medication. The feds have been offering a $50,000 reward "for information leading to the recovery of Nancy Guthrie and/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance" ... anyone with information is asked to contact 1-800-CALL-FBI or visit tips.fbi.gov.

schema.headline: Massive Police Presence At Arizona Home in Connection to Nancy Guthrie Abduction
